com.appglu.android
Class AppGluSettings

java.lang.Object
  com.appglu.android.AppGluSettings

public class AppGluSettings
extends Object

This class contains configuration and customization settings and is used to initialize the AppGlu singleton.
To create it, you will need access credentials to authenticate the SDK on the server side. You will have access to it by logging in on AppGlu's dashboard web site.
To initialize AppGlu you can use the following code:

AppGluSettings settings = new AppGluSettings("appKey", "appSecret");
AppGlu.initialize(this, settings);

You can also set variables to customize AppGlu before initializing it like below:

AppGluSettings settings = new AppGluSettings("appKey", "appSecret");

settings.setLoggerLevel(LoggerLevel.DEBUG);
settings.setDefaultStorageCacheManager(new MemoryAndFileSystemCacheManager(this));

AppGlu.initialize(this, settings);

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
AppGlu

AppGluSettings

public AppGluSettings(String applicationKey,
                      String applicationSecret)
Parameters:
applicationKey - a randomly generated unique key specific for each mobile application
applicationSecret - the secret key used to authenticate this application

AppGluSettings

public AppGluSettings(String applicationKey,
                      String applicationSecret,
                      String applicationEnvironment)
Parameters:
applicationKey - a randomly generated unique key specific for each mobile application
applicationSecret - the secret key used to authenticate this application
applicationEnvironment - environment name to be accessed on the AppGlu server. Normally set to PRODUCTION_ENVIRONMENT or STAGING_ENVIRONMENT, if not set PRODUCTION_ENVIRONMENT is assumed

AppGluSettings

public AppGluSettings(String applicationKey,
                      String applicationSecret,
                      String applicationEnvironment,
                      String baseUrl)
Parameters:
applicationKey - a randomly generated unique key specific for each mobile application
applicationSecret - the secret key used to authenticate this application
applicationEnvironment - environment name to be accessed on the AppGlu server. Normally set to PRODUCTION_ENVIRONMENT or STAGING_ENVIRONMENT, if not set PRODUCTION_ENVIRONMENT is assumed
baseUrl - the server URL to point to, if different from the default DEFAULT_BASE_URL

public String getApplicationKey()
Returns a randomly generated unique key specific for each mobile application.

getApplicationSecret

public String getApplicationSecret()
Returns the secret key used to authenticate this application.

getApplicationEnvironment

public String getApplicationEnvironment()
Returns the environment name that is being accessed on the AppGlu server. Normally set to PRODUCTION_ENVIRONMENT or STAGING_ENVIRONMENT, if not set PRODUCTION_ENVIRONMENT is assumed.

getBaseUrl

public String getBaseUrl()
Returns the server URL the SDK is pointing to, by default is DEFAULT_BASE_URL.

public String getApplicationVersion()

public LoggerLevel getLoggerLevel()
Returns the LoggerLevel used by the SDK. By default is LoggerLevel.INFO.

See Also:
Logger, LoggerFactory

setLoggerLevel

public void setLoggerLevel(LoggerLevel loggerLevel)
Sets the LoggerLevel.

See Also:
Logger, LoggerFactory

setUploadAnalyticsSessionsToServer

public void setUploadAnalyticsSessionsToServer(boolean uploadAnalyticsSessionsToServer)
If set to false, analytics events will not be sent to AppGlu server, instead they will only be logged to the console.
Only set it to false for testing purposes. By default is true.
If you set a custom AnalyticsDispatcher then this flag will not have any use.

setAnalyticsDispatcher

public void setAnalyticsDispatcher(AnalyticsDispatcher analyticsDispatcher)
Changing the AnalyticsDispatcher implementation if you want to send analytics events to somewhere else.
By default ApiAnalyticsDispatcher is used and it will send the events to the AppGlu server.

See Also:
AnalyticsDispatcher, ApiAnalyticsDispatcher, LogAnalyticsDispatcher

setAnalyticsSessionCallback

public void setAnalyticsSessionCallback(AnalyticsSessionCallback analyticsSessionCallback)
Set this callback to receive the AnalyticsSession objects before they saved or sent to the server.
This will allow you to change them before they are sent to the REST API.

setUserSessionPersistence

public void setUserSessionPersistence(UserSessionPersistence userSessionPersistence)
Changing the UserSessionPersistence implementation if you want to save the app User object to somewhere else.
By default SharedPreferencesUserSessionPersistence is used and it will save the user data to a SharedPreferences object.

See Also:
UserSessionPersistence, MemoryUserSessionPersistence, SharedPreferencesUserSessionPersistence

setDefaultSyncDatabaseHelper

public void setDefaultSyncDatabaseHelper(SyncDatabaseHelper defaultSyncDatabaseHelper)
Defines the default SQLite database to be used by SyncApi.
You must extend SyncDatabaseHelper instead of Android's SQLiteOpenHelper and implement it's methods.

See Also:
SyncDatabaseHelper

setDefaultStorageCacheManager

public void setDefaultStorageCacheManager(CacheManager storageCacheManager)
A CacheManager is used for storing and caching files while using the StorageApi. There are three CacheManager implementations available: memory (MemoryCacheManager), disk (FileSystemCacheManager) or both (MemoryAndFileSystemCacheManager).
By default FileSystemCacheManager is used and it will cache the files on disk.

See Also:
CacheManager, MemoryCacheManager, FileSystemCacheManager, MemoryAndFileSystemCacheManager

setStorageCacheTimeToLiveInMilliseconds

public void setStorageCacheTimeToLiveInMilliseconds(long storageCacheTimeToLiveInMilliseconds)
Sets the amount of time (in milliseconds) that the files will live on the storage cache before they are checked if they are up to date with the server side.

createAppGluTemplate

protected AppGluTemplate createAppGluTemplate(android.content.Context context)
This is an extension point that can be used if you wish to extend or customize the AppGluTemplate.
